p: Because climate change contributes to the development of collective violence, it represents a security threat to the United States and other nations—a threat that has long been recognized by the US military. For example, in 2007, several former leading American military officers termed climate change a “threat multiplier for instability” ( 11, 12). The severity and widespread nature of this threat heighten the urgency of mitigating climate change and implementing effective adaptation measures to address climate change. In addition, the causative association between climate change and collective violence focuses additional attention on the critically important need to understand and reduce the underlying causes of collective violence.
